lines.content: **What worked well:** Claude excelled at generating boilerplate code, creating proper Java documentation, suggesting robust error handling patterns, and providing multiple test cases. The step-by-step Git commands and refactoring guides were particularly helpful.

**What didn't work as well:** Initial implementations sometimes had subtle bugs (like the event storage formatting issues) that required manual inspection to fix. Overall, I estimate around 60-70% time savings compared to doing it completely manually, especially for coding sections that are repetitive like the Ui Class.

Keep going  even the best programmers started out writing 'Hello World'!
Every bug you fix makes you a stronger developer. Purr-severe!
Code is like a cat: mysterious at first, but eventually you'll understand its behavior.
The best time to debug was yesterday. The second best time is meow!
Your code doesn't have to be purr-fect on the first try. Refactoring is your friend!
Debugging is like being a detective. You've got this, meow-ster detective!
The code you write today is paw-some progress toward tomorrow's success!
Remember: Stack Overflow isn't cheating, it's research. You're doing fine!
Take a break if you need one. Fresh eyes catch bugs faster. Maybe get some catnip?
Cats always land on their feet, and so will you. Keep going!
There's no such thing as a stupid question. Ask away and keep learning!
Code reviews are opportunities to learn, not judgments. Everyone started somewhere!
You've solved harder problems before. This one is no different. You've got this!
The journey of a thousand lines begins with a single function. Start small, dream big!
Your determination is admirable. Keep that paw-sitive attitude!
Remember: The best code is code that works. Optimization can come later. Ship it!
You're a real treat to have on call as a software engineer! Keep that pager close!
